intro: Aiouea floccosa, commonly known as the cloudy mistflower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its dense, fluffy inflorescences that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and white, clustered in dense, woolly clusters that resemble clouds.
